intro: Costus podocephalus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf costus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and other aromatic plants. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces striking clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. Costus podocephalus is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
